intro: Gouldia terminalis f. heterophylla, commonly known as the variegated gouldia, is a rare and striking plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae, which includes the famous kangaroo paw plants. This cultivar is characterized by its unique foliage, featuring a mix of green, white, and pink hues on its leaves. The plant produces striking red and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
